S.FORM: yɛba'llɛ tho kɔ khunɛ kumundhummɛn suru'llɛ kɔ yammu ɛtyo libaŋba kumbhɔŋasinu kundumba kumbhu kun'saˀ yammu tho kuŋg'wahaˀ khunchi cumluŋ mɛdzogɛ.
S.TRANSL: When the shaman had finished the ritual, the Libang relatives — the paternal uncles and the brothers — and the maternal uncle met together up there [in Lingkhim].

S.FORM: "ləu alla ain kɛyuŋi, taːndik kɛbegi laˀba," mɛttusi kuŋg'wa'llɛ.
S.TRANSL: "Well now, I guess you'll all stay here today and go tomorrow," said the maternal uncle.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛllɛ "mɛːn anigɛ alla mɔre yuŋma anigɛ kam hop ɛmbha yuŋma.
S.TRANSL: "No, there's no reason now for us to stay on longer.

S.FORM: iŋga — anigɛ teˀrumbɛ ɛtthonu khunɛ kudzaŋhaˀ," phɛaŋ kɔ yammu kumbhu kun'saˀ kumbhɔŋa kundumbarɛ mɛmɛttu.
S.TRANSL: We'll take his clothes back down," the brothers and paternal uncles replied.

S.FORM: kuŋg'wanaŋ "khɔmbhɔ kɔrɔ teˀrammɛ!" phɛaŋ kɔ mɛburu mɛyusu kudettɛn.
S.TRANSL: "In that case, take them!" said the maternal uncle, and they gave them the clothes.

S.FORM: mɛburu mɛyusuaŋ — mɛburu mɛyususi'llɛ kɔ mɛyuːruaŋ mɛy'yɛ libaŋ kɛyuŋbahaˀrɛ kɔ.
S.TRANSL: They gave them to them and sent them down, and they brought them down, the ones who lived in Libang.

S.FORM: kumbhɔŋa kundumbasi kɔ jəmmə mɛyuːruaŋ mɛy'yɛ'llɛ kɔ ɛtyo mɛyuːruaŋ khunchi yammu mɛdɔŋsiŋ.
S.TRANSL: The paternal uncles brought them down here, and then they met together again.

S.FORM: "ləu alla thedhe cokma poŋ ani?" phɛaŋ mɛdɔŋsiŋŋɛllɛ ni,
S.TRANSL: "Well, now what should we do?" they asked, when they met.

S.FORM: "alla tho thiklɛŋ kɔ kɛgɛŋb'ɛllɛ kusammɛn kuŋg'wasirɛ — kuŋg'wa'llɛ sɛru.
S.TRANSL: "His maternal uncle has already killed the soul once up there.

S.FORM: alla aniaŋ ɛtyo kɔ thiklɛŋ sɛtma poŋ.
S.TRANSL: Now we should kill it down here too.

S.FORM: tərə tho khunɛ sɛrui mɛːnni? ani yɔllik caha mɛdzoknɛn sɛtma," phɛaŋ kɔ
S.TRANSL: But he killed it up there, right? We don't have to do much, to kill it."

S.FORM: khunchi cumluŋ mɛdzogɛaŋ kɔ yɛban mɛdhaktuaŋ bihandik mɛdhaktu.
S.TRANSL: They met and in the morning they brought up the shaman.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ mundhum cogu khunɛ khɔmbhɛaŋ yɛba'llɛ yammu uːttuaŋ kɔ na sumlam doˀm'ɛtna teˀruaŋ khunɛ yammu yɛba'llɛ sɛru.
S.TRANSL: The shaman did a ritual — he called it and led it over to a three-way intersection and killed it.

S.FORM: uːttuaŋ kɔ hiptu sɛru.
S.TRANSL: He called it, and he knocked it dead.

S.FORM: tho kɔ mɛdhoktuaŋ mɛsɛru ɛtyo hiptuaŋ sɛru muktu samsiŋŋɛllɛ.
S.TRANSL: Up above they cooked it to death, but down here he struck it dead with laurel and a stalk of muktu.

S.FORM: sɛruaŋ kɔ lam lɔt saktu.
S.TRANSL: He killed it and closed off the road.

S.FORM: lam saktuaŋ khunɛ sat ʈhaũ yammu lam saktu.
S.TRANSL: He blocked the road in seven places,

S.FORM: muktu samsiŋŋɛllɛ thɛptuaŋ kɔ mɛndama gəri khunɛ.
S.TRANSL: planting muktu sticks and laurel so that it wouldn't come back.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ ɛtyonu kumbhɔŋa kundumbahaˀrɛ abhe mɛdzogu kɔ phɛllɛ kumbhɔŋanu kundumba mɛdɔŋsiŋŋaŋ kɛsib'ɛllɛn khunɛ kujəgga kujəminɛtmunu — kughambekkɛtmunu mɛlɔːttu.
S.TRANSL: Then what his paternal uncles did down here was, they got together and got some cash out of the dead man's land [by raising the value of the mortgage].

S.FORM: pəisa mɛlɔːttuaŋ yammu saːŋwa pit mɛiŋu khəsi boka mɛiŋu ?? pimasi — khi kɛwaːtpahaˀ phoksu.
S.TRANSL: They got some cash and bought a buffalo and a cow, they bought goats — they raised money for brahmans.

S.FORM: "khi kɛwaːtpahaˀ pima caha mɛdzoknɛn kɛgɛŋpa kɛsib'ɛllɛn kɔ,
S.TRANSL: "It's not necessary to give anything to brahmans, in the case of someone who dies in a fall,

S.FORM: ɛmbha kɛdukpa kɛsib'ɛn lɔt ni caha cokpa," phɛaŋ yammu kundumba'llɛ lɔˀrɛ'llɛ kɔ pittɛn mɛyɛpsu.
S.TRANSL: it's only necessary when someone dies normally, of illness!" said his elder paternal uncle, and he kept the cow.

S.FORM: khi kɛwaˀb'ɛn mɛmburun.
S.TRANSL: They didn't give it to brahmans.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ kɔ — saːŋwa thiknu mɛːnda thik — ləu! yammu khunchi mɛyuŋsiŋŋaŋ khunchi thɛgek kundumbarɛ suyuaŋ tin car din səmmə khunchi yummɛtmu mɛyuŋɛaŋ kɔ yummɛtmu mɛyuŋɛaŋ kɔ yammu luŋghimba naidɛmba phɛmbasɔŋ tin thər mɛyuksusiaŋ khunchi yammu —
S.TRANSL: They set aside the buffalo and the goat, and the senior paternal uncle shaved his head, and for three or four days they remained fasting [without eating salt]. When they had fasted, they called together the three clans, the Lungkhimba, the Naidemba, and the Phembasong.

S.FORM: kundumbarɛ kudhɛgekkɛn suyuaŋ car din the khunchi yammu khunchi khɔmbha suddhə mɛdzoksiŋ.
S.TRANSL: His uncle shaved his head, and after four days they purified themselves.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ khunchi khannɛn mɛburu mɛdesu.
S.TRANSL: Then they made the offering [?of the buffalo and the goat to the dead man].

S.FORM: mɛburu mɛdesu'llɛ "alla kɛgɛŋpa kɛsib'ɛllɛ kulammɛnnu ɛmbha kɛdukpa kɛsib'ɛllɛ kulammɛn mɛdɔŋnɛn.
S.TRANSL: When they made the offering, they said, "The path of someone who falls to his death is different from the road of someone who dies of illness.

S.FORM: lam atti kɔ?" phɛaŋ mɛdzogu'llɛ
S.TRANSL: Which is it?" they said.

S.FORM: "kɛgɛŋpa kɛsib'ɛllɛ kulam kɔ atti?
S.TRANSL: "Which is the path of one who dies in a fall?

S.FORM: ɛmbha kɛdukpa kɛsib'ɛllɛ kulammɛnnu mɛdɔŋnɛn phɛaŋ jəmməhaˀrɛ anisummaŋ waˀ" phɛaŋ yammu khunchi mɛlɔˀrɛ.
S.TRANSL: We all know that it is different from the path of one who dies of illness," they said.

S.FORM: "khɔmbhɛaŋ alla kɛgɛŋpa kɛsib'ɛllɛ kɔ khɔyarik caha mɛdzoknɛn.
S.TRANSL: "Now this case of accidental death does not require that much.

S.FORM: indɛn tho yɛba'llɛaŋ teˀru.
S.TRANSL: Already, up there, the shaman has taken some [of the dead man's possessions] away.

S.FORM: ɛtyo yɛba'llɛaŋ cɛːtcik mɛndeˀɛ mɛnuˀnɛn ɛtyoaŋ a."
S.TRANSL: But it wouldn't do for the shaman down here not to take a little away as well."

S.FORM: ɛtyoaŋ yɛban mɛburu kɛgɛŋpa kɛsib'ɛllɛ ɛtyoba kumba kummarɛ mɛgɔttuba cɛtthiya nɛtchi thenu lumba thik khori thik mɛburu mɛdesu yɛba ɛtyob'ɛn.
S.TRANSL: So they gave the shaman some things which had belonged to the victim's parents — they gave two brass plates, a woman's eating-dish, and a water bowl to the shaman down here as well.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ kɔ khunɛ phunu saˀrɛ "cɛːtcik ɛmbha kudzwaːttɛtmu thaŋ allɔːnnɛn," phɛaŋ kɔ
S.TRANSL: Then the brothers said, "We're still not completely out of our fast.

S.FORM: khunchi yammu, "c'waːttɛtmunu mu mut adha," phɛaŋ kɔ saːŋwa cuːkpa thiknu mɛːnda thik mɛsɛruaŋ khunchi yammu luŋghimba naidɛmba mɛuːttusiaŋ ɛmbha yum saɛtmu ni khunchi kɔ kɛgɛŋpa kɛsib'ɛllɛ mɛbhuˀru mɛdesu.
S.TRANSL: We're still in an impure state." So they killed a small buffalo and a goat, and they called the Lunkhimba and the Naidemba [clans], and by eating meat and salt they completely severed the links of the dead man.

S.FORM: ɛmbha kɛdukpaaŋ kɛsib'ɛllɛ kɔ khɔmbha mɛːndu.
S.TRANSL: It's not like that for someone who dies of illness.

S.FORM: khɔnnɛn kɔ tho thɛbasammɛttho sama poŋ.
S.TRANSL: Such a one has to be delivered up to the ancestors.

S.FORM: kɛgɛŋpa kɛsib'ɛllɛn cəĩ thɛbasammɛtmu mɛbeknɛn khunɛ kɔ — khunɛ kɔ.
S.TRANSL: But one who has died in a fall doesn't go to the ancestors.

S.FORM: abheba kɛgɛŋpa kɛsib'ɛllɛ khunɛ kɔ kulam kɔ lam mɛdɔŋnɛn.
S.TRANSL: His path is different.

S.FORM: ɛmbha kɛgɛŋb'ɛllɛn thaŋ mɛgɛtnɛn phɛaŋ kɔ khɔn lam mɛsak — lam sakma poŋ phɛaŋ kɔ. khɔmbhɛaŋ mundhum waˀ.
S.TRANSL: Since his path doesn't go up there, they close off that path — it must be blocked. There is a ritual.

S.FORM: kɛgɛŋpa kɛsib'ɛllɛn cəĩ nu ɛmbha kɛsib'ɛllɛn mɛdɔŋnɛn.
S.TRANSL: The path of the victim of a fall is different from the path of someone who dies a natural death.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛllɛ kɛgɛŋpa kɛsib'ɛllɛn ɛmbha bihandikpa yum caɛtmu mɛbhuˀru mɛdesu.
S.TRANSL: In the morning, in the ceremony of eating salt [to end their fast], they sever the links of the victim.

S.FORM: luŋghimba naidɛmba phɛmbasɔŋ jəmmə mɛbhuŋsiŋŋaŋ paŋbɔpma uttərhaŋŋɛllɛ kɔ kubərkhitmu mɛbhuˀruaŋ mɛsuru.
S.TRANSL: The Lunkhimba, the Naidemba, and the Phembasong [clans] all gathered, at the funeral of the Pangbopma [clan member], Uttarhang, and they completely cut him off.

S.FORM: mɛsuruaŋ khanhaˀ phudoŋ thikthik mɛburusiaŋ mɛbe khanhaˀ.
S.TRANSL: When they had finished they gave a gift [usually a goat] to each clan, and the others left.

S.FORM: sər, əbə tyəti nəi ho!
S.TRANSL: Sir, that's all!
